en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the total score of the ISTH-SCC bleeding assessment tool.
keywords: international society on thrombosis and haemostasis
en.use:
This tool assesses the presence and severity of bleeding symptoms and can serve as a screening tool to determine which patients require additional laboratory evaluation. For the calculation, only symptoms and treatment BEFORE and AT diagnosis should be considered.

It has been validated in various inherited bleeding disorder populations, including von Willebrand disease, hemophilia, and platelet disorders.

Results may inform the need for further diagnostic workup in patients with a suspected inherited bleeding disorder.
- Low scores are associated with a low likelihood of a bleeding disorder, and additional evaluation may not be warranted.
- Elevated scores indicate an increased risk of bleeding; further evaluation for an underlying inherited bleeding disorder is appropriate (e.g., laboratory studies, specialty consultation).

Distinction between 0 and 1 is of critical importance. Score 1 means that the symptom is judged as present in the patient’s history by the interviewer but does not qualify for a score 2 or more.

* Consultation only: the patient sought medical evaluation and was either referred to a specialist or offered detailed laboratory investigation.

** E.g., 1 extraction/surgery resulting in bleeding (100%): the score to be assigned is 2;

2 extractions/surgeries, 1 resulting in bleeding (50%): the score to be assigned is 2;

3 extractions/surgeries, 1 resulting in bleeding (33%): the score to be assigned is 2;

4 extractions/surgeries, 1 resulting in bleeding (25%): the score to be assigned is 1.
en.misuse:
The tool has been validated for use in adults and children, although sensitivity is lower in pediatric populations.

It has low sensitivity for acquired bleeding disorders.

Results are not intended to be diagnostic but should be used as part of a comprehensive evaluation in conjunction with clinical judgment and specialty consultation.

other_details.en: An assessment tool used to evaluate patients with a suspected inherited bleeding disorder.
other_details.references:
Rodeghiero F, et al. ISTH/SSC bleeding assessment tool: a standardized questionnaire and a proposal for a new bleeding score for inherited bleeding disorders. J Thromb Haemost. 2010 Sep;8(9):2063–5.

Elbatarny M, Mollah S, Grabell J, et al. Normal range of bleeding scores for the ISTH-BAT: adult and pediatric data from the merging project. Haemophilia. 2014 Nov;20(6):831–5.

Borhany M, Fatima N, Abid M, Shamsi T, Othman M. Application of the ISTH bleeding score in hemophilia. Transfus Apher Sci. 2018 Aug;57(4):556–60.

Gresele P, Orsini S, Noris P, et al. Validation of the ISTH/SSC bleeding assessment tool for inherited platelet disorders: a communication from the Platelet Physiology SSC. J Thromb Haemost. 2020 Mar;18(3):732–9.

Kalot MA, Husainat N, Tayiem S, et al. Bleeding assessment tools in the diagnosis of VWD in adults and children: a systematic review and meta-analysis of test accuracy. Blood Adv. 2021 Dec 14;5(23):5023–31.

Rezende SM, Neumann I, Angchaisuksiri P, et al. International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis clinical practice guideline for treatment of congenital hemophilia A and B based on the Grading of Recommendations Assessment, Development, and Evaluation methodology. J Thromb Haemost. 2024 Sep;22(9):2629–52.

allowed_values: 1|local::at0044|Present (not associated with ulcer, portal hypertension, hemorrhoids, angiodysplasia)|
1|local::at0054|Reported in ≤25% of all procedures, no intervention|
2|local::at0055|Reported in >25% of all procedures, no intervention|
1|local::at0039|Reported in ≤25% of all procedures, no intervention|
2|local::at0040|Reported in >25% of all procedures, no intervention|
1|local::at0060|Consultation only, changing pads more frequently than every 2 hours, clot and flooding, or PBAC score>100|
2|local::at0061|Time off work/school >2 /year, requiring antifibrinolytics, or hormonal/iron therapy|
3|local::at0062|Requiring combined treatment with antifibrinolytics and hormonal therapy or menorrhagia present since menarche and >12 months|

4|local::at0063|Acute menorrhagia requiring hospital admission and emergency treatment, requiring blood transfusion/replacement therapy/desmopressin, requiring dilatation&curettage/endometrial ablation, or hysterectomy|
1|local::at0066|Consultation only, use of oxytocin, or lochia >6 weeks|
3|local::at0068|Requiring blood transfusion, replacement therapy, desmopressin, or requiring examination under anesthesia and/or the use of uterine balloon/package to tamponade the uterus|
4|local::at0069|Any procedure requiring critical care or surgical intervention|
3|local::at0074|Spontaneous or traumatic, requiring desmopressin or replacement therapy|
4|local::at0075|Spontaneous or traumatic, requiring surgical intervention or blood transfusion|
3|local::at0080|Spontaneous or traumatic, requiring desmopressin or replacement therapy|
4|local::at0081|Spontaneous or traumatic, requiring surgical intervention or blood transfusion|

$gt0015|Muscle hematomas|==local::at0079|Spontaneous or traumatic, requiring surgical intervention or blood transfusion|

$gt0018|Other bleeding|==local::at0092|Blood transfusion, replacement therapy, or desmopressin|

gt0001.description: An assessment tool given by the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis- Scientific Standardization Committee, which can be used to evaluate patients with a suspected inherited bleeding disorder.
